items.title: Bayern kan het ook op een koude januari-avond in Keulen
items.summary: Zeventien duels, 47 punten, 66 goals voor en slechts dertien tegen: de cijfers van Bayern M√ºnchen in de Bundesliga zijn hallucinant. Woensdag won de Champions League-tegenstander van PSV met 1-3 bij 1. FC K√∂ln. In deze video zie je de goals van Bayern.

items.title: Schaamte, woede, ongeloof: harde woorden bij Ajax na ongekende afgang
items.summary: Ajax is woensdag op historische wijze vernederd door AZ: 6-0. De ploeg van Fred Grim zakte op alle manieren collectief door de ondergrens. De trainer en gelegenheidsaanvoerder Youri Regeer zoeken naar verklaringen. ‚ÄòWat we met z‚Äôn allen hebben laten zien, is verschrikkelijk.‚Äô

items.title: What does xG predict for the rest of the season?
items.summary: With more than half the season gone, we have enough stats to get a good idea of how well Premier League teams have been playing and therefore how things will likely unfold in the months ahead.

items.title: Arbeloa door het stof na rampdebuut bij Real: 'Dit is mijn verantwoordelijkheid'
items.summary: √Ålvaro Arbeloa was hard voor zichzelf na de enorme bekerblamage van Real Madrid tegen Albacete, de nummer zeventien van het tweede Spaanse niveau. De trainerswissel bij Real Madrid had niet het gewenste schokeffect en Arbeloa nam de volledige verantwoordelijkheid.

items.title: Raducanu in line for Sabalenka rematch after Australian Open draw
items.summary: Emma Raducanu has been handed a tough path at the Australian Open despite being seeded, with world No 1 Aryna Sabalenka potentially awaiting in the third round.

items.title: Marokko in de wolken dankzij 'beste penalty-killer ter wereld'
items.summary: Yassine Bounou kon op de nodige complimenten rekenen na afloop van de door Marokko gewonnen halve finale van de Afrika Cup tegen Nigeria. De doelman werd de grote held met twee gekeerde strafschoppen in de penaltyserie.

items.title: What to expect from F1's early launch season after huge rules reset
items.summary: The New Year may be just two weeks old but Formula 1 teams' preparations for the 2026 season are poised to kick off on Thursday night when the Red Bull teams launch their engine partnership with Ford by showing off their latest liveries in Detroit.

items.title: Kodai Sano, de Japanse goudmijn van NEC
items.summary: Het is niet meer de vraag of, maar wanneer Kodai Sano vertrekt bij NEC. De 22-jarige Japanner moet de volgende recordtransfer worden bij de Nijmeegse club. Over hoe hij in twee√´nhalf jaar uitgroeide tot een bepalende speler. ‚ÄòSoms denk ik: Zou hij weleens spanning voelen?‚Äô

items.title: Raducanu in quarter-final action at Hobart International
Arbeloa: Madrid Copa exit to 2nd-tier side 'painful'
items.summary: New Real Madrid coach √Ålvaro Arbeloa took responsibility for the team's "painful" 3-2 Copa del Rey defeat to second-tier Albacete on Wednesday, defending his decision to rest a number of senior players.

items.title: Chelsea's Rosenior: Blame me for S√°nchez errors
items.summary: Liam Rosenior has urged Chelsea fans to blame him for Robert S√°nchez's two mistakes which helped Arsenal to a 3-2 victory in Wednesday's Carabao Cup semifinal, first leg at Stamford Bridge.

items.title: FIFA requests for World Cup tickets passes 500M
items.summary: FIFA said Wednesday it has received more than 500 million ticket requests for this year's World Cup.

items.title: Eto'o banned over alleged AFCON misbehavior
items.summary: Cameroonian Football Federation president Samuel Eto'o has been suspended for four games for alleged misbehavior during his team's loss to Morocco at the Africa Cup of Nations.

items.title: Hearts 'underdogs by long shot' but still setting Premiership pace
items.summary: If it seemed Hearts made a statement by winning with 10 men at Dundee on Sunday, they upped the ante against St Mirren four days later.

items.title: O'Neill calls for patience on Celtic transfers
items.summary: The Celtic manager Martin O'Neill says "cut me a little bit of slack" as the club work on bringing in new faces this month.

items.title: Arsenal take step to ending semi-final nightmares - but regrets remain
items.summary: Arsenal's 3-2 win at Chelsea seizes control of their EFL Cup tie - and overcoming their poor record in semi-finals will be the big positive for Mikel Arteta.

items.title: Arbeloa starts Real Madrid tenure with disastrous Copa del Rey defeat at Albacete
items.summary: Last 16: Albacete 3-2 Real Madrid Stoppage-time winner secures huge upset For 20 minutes of √Ålvaro Arbeloa‚Äôs debut as manager of Real Madrid, the fog came down and no one could see any football. For the other 70, they couldn‚Äôt either. Not from his team, at least. From Albacete Balompi√©, 17th in the second division, they witnessed something magical. An outrageous goal scored with single second to go was the perfect end to the greatest story they ever told, history made. When the final whistle went, Madrid headed straight down the tunnel, defeated again, while the party began in the Carlos Belmonte. Arbeloa had said he wanted to see Vin√≠cius J√∫nior dance; instead, it was Albacete‚Äôs fans who would, long into the night of their lives. This could not have been any better; at Madrid, things can always get worse, the crisis deepening. Careful what you wish for and all that. ‚ÄúAt this club every defeat is a tragedy, so imagine one like this,‚Äù Arbeloa said. ‚ÄúFailure is the road to success,‚Äù Madrid‚Äôs new manager added, insisting he was not afraid, that he had suffered eliminations even worse, but this had hurt. Continue reading...

items.title: Morocco book place in home Afcon final as Bounou denies Nigeria in shootout
items.summary: Morocco advanced to the Africa Cup of Nations final on penalties, beating Nigeria 4-2 in the final shootout after their semi-final ended goalless after extra time. Yassine Bounou saved two spot kicks for the tournament hosts, keeping out Samuel Chukwueze and Bruno Onyemaechi‚Äôs efforts. Nigeria keeper Stanley Nwabali denied Hamza Igamane with the first save of the shootout, but it proved to be in vain. Continue reading...

items.title: Bayern's record-breaking Bundesliga season in numbers
items.summary: BBC Sport examines the stunning numbers behind Bayern Munich's record-breaking start to the Bundesliga season - and what records they could topple.

items.title: S√°nchez errors hand Arsenal first-leg lead despite Garnacho‚Äôs Chelsea double
items.summary: It was the latest display of Arsenal‚Äôs power and aggression, their remorselessness. And when it was over, this Carabao Cup semi-final felt firmly within their grip. But for a late goal from the Chelsea substitute Alejandro Garnacho, his second of an eventful cameo, it would surely have been over. Even so, it was difficult on this evidence to predict anything other than Arsenal progressing into the final; moving closer to a rare piece of silverware under Mikel Arteta ‚Äì one to pave the way for others this season?
